page.title: 11The Boulevard,Stoke
page.content: Between Boothen C.E. Primary and London Road,Stoke there is a boulevard.The boulevard is a footpath lined on both sides with trees and grass and some flowers.There are also a few benches. Older people sit on them to chat with each other.Mums sometimes rest there on the way back from shopping. The proper name for the boulevard is Coronation Gardens.It is called that because it was opened in 1953,the year of the Queen's Coronation and cost 700 pounds to construct.Coronation Gardens used to be the Newcastle canal. The canal was built in 1795-6 and it ran from the Trent and Mersey Canal.But the canal did not seem profitable and so in 1938 it was filled in. The area of the boulevard is 2 1/4 acres, and it is maintained by the Parks and Recreation Department.
